    Aft Cockpit:

    • (2) L-shaped settees, convertible to full width of cockpit
    • (2) GRP coffee table with built-in 19” lift- and tilt-screens

    HULL & CONSTRUCTION

    A composite construction of epoxy resin, carbon fiber, Kevlar and E glass with Nomex core. Her draft offers a minimum of 4’7” with boards up and a maximum of 10’8” with boards down.

    Exterior Paint:

    • Hulls: Alexseal “Cloud White” epoxy
    • Decks: Alexseal “Matterhorn White” epoxy

    Interior Paint:

    • Alexseal “Oyster White” epoxy

    Bottom Paint:

    • Petit “Vivid White” antifoul

    Cockpit Floor:

    • Traditional teak caulked planks

    Interior Sole:

    • Wide hand-selected teak planks

    Interior Cabinetry:

    • White birch veneer
    • Cedar-lined closets
    • Teak counter tops
    • Automatic interior closet lights when opened
    • Soft-close doors and drawers

Accommodations:
Master Stateroom:

Aft; King 6' 6" length berth w/ensuite, private electric vacuflush head and separate shower w/seat. Equipped w/TV/DVD/CD, vanity table, writing desk, large hanging lockers & lots of drawers.

Guest Stateroom 1:

Mid-ship Port; Double 6' 6" length berth w/ensuite, private electric vacuflush head and shower. Equipped w/plenty of storage space in outboard lockers, drawers and a hanging locker.

Guest Stateroom 2:

Mid-ship, Starboard Double 6' 6" length berth sharing an electric vacuflush head and shower. This stateroom has private access to the head and is equipped with plenty of storage space in outboard lockers, drawers and a hanging locker.

Guest Stateroom 3:

Forward, Starboard Queen 6' 6" length berth w/an upper single berth, sharing an electric vacuflush head and shower. This stateroom has private access to the shared head and is equipped with plenty of storage space in drawers and a hanging locker. Can accommodate up to 3 people especially if used as a bunk cabin for children.
The crew cabins are located forward w/separate head/shower, dining area and companionway.

Crew Quarters
The crew quarters are located forward with access through a deck hatch and from the companionway in the guest accommodation.
The Captains double berth is forward. The other cabin has twin upper & lower berths. The head & shower are located forward of the crew dining area on the port side. An additional crew bunk is available in the crew mess providing accommodations for up to 5 crew.? The washer/dryer is located in the crew quarters.

Galley:
Broadwater four burner stove with oven and broiler NEW 2014
Double SS Sinks

Stainless Steel counters

Foot pumps for fresh and salt wash.

Sails:

1, Spinnaker asymmetrical with sock

1. storm sail

2. full batten mains with Harken car system

1. Furling Harken system 

All blocks are Harken Black Magic air blocks

New Galley with stainless steel countertops, New stainless fridge and freezer, New stove.

New Headhunter ($1000) fresh water pump

New Awlgrip paint 2014, hull and deck.

New 1200W solar system 2014

New headsail with Hydracell fabric 2014

New keel bolts

New rudder bearing

Both masts removed, inspected, all NEW DAYNEEMA halyards!

New 2013 Dodger and bimini.

New 400 ft G4 anchor chain 2013

New dinghy (aluminum bottom) 2014

New 15HP outboard 2014

Standing rig done 2012 with quick release inner stay

Accommodations:
Master Stateroom:

Aft; King 6' 6" length berth w/ensuite, private electric vacuflush head and separate shower w/seat. Equipped w/TV/DVD/CD, vanity table, writing desk, large hanging lockers & lots of drawers.

Guest Stateroom 1:

Mid-ship Port; Double 6' 6" length berth w/ensuite, private electric vacuflush head and shower. Equipped w/plenty of storage space in outboard lockers, drawers and a hanging locker.

Guest Stateroom 2:

Mid-ship, Starboard Double 6' 6" length berth sharing an electric vacuflush head and shower. This stateroom has private access to the head and is equipped with plenty of storage space in outboard lockers, drawers and a hanging locker.

Guest Stateroom 3:

Forward, Starboard Queen 6' 6" length berth w/an upper single berth, sharing an electric vacuflush head and shower. This stateroom has private access to the shared head and is equipped with plenty of storage space in drawers and a hanging locker. Can accommodate up to 3 people especially if used as a bunk cabin for children.
The crew cabins are located forward w/separate head/shower, dining area and companionway.

Crew Quarters
The crew quarters are located forward with access through a deck hatch and from the companionway in the guest accommodation.
The Captains double berth is forward. The other cabin has twin upper & lower berths. The head & shower are located forward of the crew dining area on the port side. An additional crew bunk is available in the crew mess providing accommodations for up to 5 crew.? The washer/dryer is located in the crew quarters.

Designer: George H. Stadel Jr.

Year Built: 1984

 

Construction: Carvel Planked on saw frames

Planking and ceiling: Formosan red cyprus, 1 3/4" thick. Bronze screw fastened.

Frames, stem knee, and forefoot knee: Dragon's eye, a dark red wood 50% stronger and stiffer than white oak. Frames are double sawn, sided and molded 2 1/2 "

Keel: Taiwan red oak. Not similar to US red oak. It is harder and denser with a resin which seals the pores.

Stem, engine beds and beams: Eastern acacia, a tougher version of our black locust.

Shelves, clamp and belt construction: Batu, a strong teak like wood, available in long lengths.

Masts: Hollow box section of Taiwanese spruce.
Decks, bulwarks, cabin trunk, and cabin sole: Teak.

1981 Chris White 52 Juniper Trimaran
beam:
30 feet

Draft: 4 feet 6 inches

Construction
Three layers of eastern white cedar bonded with epoxy resin. Outer surfaces sheathed in glass reinforcement also bonded with epoxy resin.

Topsides
The topsides are fair and have been finished in light blue two part paint that has been applied by roller to a reasonable standard.

Underwater coatings
2016 - The antifouling was sanded right back to obtain a very smooth finish. Two coats of grey hard racing and one coat of ablative antifouling were applied.

Keel
Fixed timber keel giving a draft of 4 feet 6 inches.

Rudder
Timber rudder sheathed in glass reinforcement and bonded with epoxy resin. The rudder is in good condition. Some minor slack in the lower bearing.

Layout
In the main hull there is a double berth towards the bow. Further aft there is a dining table with settee berths to port and starboard. Aft of the dining area there is a large galley to starboard and a refrigerator and washroom with toilet to port. Towards the stern is the navigation area and a double berth. Steps lead up to the aft cockpit and helm position. Beneath the floor of the navigation area is the diesel engine.

Internal hull surfaces
The internal surfaces of the main hull are good. The lacquer in the saloon and forward cabin would benefit from refurbishment.
2016 - The lacquer in the navigation area and galley was recoated.

The starboard hull was punctured above the waterline in 2015 and correctly repaired with three layers of laminated timber.

The port hull has been punctured above the waterline at some time and repaired with polyester fillers. This is a cosmetic defect.

Galley
2016 - Dometic Starlight two burner stainless steel gas stove with oven and grill.
2016 - Work surfaces lacquered.
Sink with freshwater supplied by foot pump.
Sink with salt water supplied by foot pump.
Various cupboards and lockers.

The galley area and all the associated equipment is clean and in good condition.

Interior joinery
Juniper´s interior joinery is finished in lacquer and white paint. The joinery is all in good condition and functioning correctly.

Furnishings & linings
2016 - The mattresses and saloon cushions were replaced with fire resistant foam and new blue fabric. The head linings are white painted.

Windows, ports & hatches
Opening hatches are provided over the living spaces.
The companionway is closed by a sliding hatch.
Fixed and opening windows are set into the hull.

Masts & spars
Carbon fibre rotating wing mainmast by King Spars. White painted in very good condition.
Timber rotating wing mizzenmast. White painted in very good condition.
Two aluminium booms.

Standing rigging
2016 - Mainmast standing rigging replaced in 1 x 19 stainless steel wire.
2016 - Profurl jib furling stripped and all extrusion joints replaced.
2009 - Mizzenmast standing rigging replaced in 1 x 19 stainless steel wire.

Running rigging & winches
2016 - All winches serviced and spinnaker winches installed in the cockpit.
2016 - Halyards replaced in dyneema
2016 - All polyester running rigging washed and checked for chafe.

Sails
Mainsail is fully battened in dacron with three slab reefs. Very good condition.
Mizzen is fully battened in laminate with two reefs. Well used but good shape.
Jib is laminated and in good condition
Spinnaker 1 is 2oz nylon.  Requires a patch on the luff and one on the foot.
Spinnaker 2 in 1.5oz nylon in very good condition.

Decks
2016 - Decks painted in white non slip paint.

Mooring arrangements
Two aluminium alloy cleats on the main foredeck.
Three aluminium alloy cleats on each float.
One aluminium alloy cleat on the stern of the main hull.

Canvas work
Blue polyester mainsail cover in good condition.
Blue polyester mizzen cover in good condition.
Blue polyester companionway cover in good condition.

Engine
Three cylinder 27hp Kubota diesel converted for marine use by Beta Marine UK. Excellent little engine with 3500 hours. Starts well with no smoke and runs perfectly. Burns 1 litre per hour. Cruising speed 5 knots in calm conditions.
2016 - Fully serviced.

Morse controls
Single lever morse controls are fitted in the cockpit. The lever and control box are visually in good condition. The lever is moving freely.

Stern gear
A mechanical Hurth gearbox is bolted to the engine. The shaft runs through a ceramic seal and is supported by a cutlass bearing in a bronze P bracket.
A two bladed bronze folding propeller is attached to the end of the shaft.

Diesel storage & supply
Diesel fuel is stored in an epoxy sheathed tank located aft of the engine. Capacity approximately 45 gallons.

2016 - Flexible fuel lines replaced and Racor water separator filter serviced. Engine mounted fuel filter replaced.

Steering gear
Stainless steel wheel drives chains and cables that drive and Edson bronze quadrant.
2016 - Steering cables replaced with spares included in the ships inventory.

Bilge pumps
A Whale MK IV is situated forward in the main hull.
A hand operated pump is provided for the engine space.
Hand operated pumps are provided for the floats.

Gas installation
2016 - The gas installation and supply was completely renewed.
2016 - New 13kg glass fibre gas bottle installed.

Plumbing washroom & toilet installation
Lavac hand operated toilet with black water holding tank.
Small hand basin with cold water outlet.
Foot pump for salt water to galley
Foot pump for freshwater to galley.
Water stored in flooded section of the main hull. Approximately 120 gallons.
2016 - Extra 45 gallon water tank installed beneath the forward cabin berth.

Tenders & outboards
7 foot inflatable tender.
8 foot inflatable tender with 4hp Mariner two stroke outboard in good condition.

Electrical installation
Six 120 AH gel batteries -New 2013.
Six solar panels with Outback charge controller.
Sterling 40AMP charger and 1500 watt AC inverter.
80 AMP alternator fitted to the engine.
Galvanic isolator on shore power cable.

2016 - Vessel rewired.
2016 - LED lights installed throughout accommodation.

Refrigeration
Large well insulated cool box.
2016 - Waeco refrigeration compressor installed.

Firefighting equipment
Gas fire extinguisher with thermal release in the engine space.
Four powder fire extinguishers
Fire blanket.

 

Navigation area & equipment
2016 - Plastimo 135 offshore steering compass.
Graphene class B AIS configured to run lap top navigation program.
Furuno GP 32 GPS
Lowence GPS
Furuno Naxtex.
Uniden VHF.
Laptop navigation program
Raymarine ST40 echo sounder with repeater.


Lifesaving equipment

2016 - Six person ISO ocean life raft
2016 - Two horseshoe buoys with lamps.
2016 - Dan buoy.
2016 - ACR 406 MHz EPIRB
2016 - Ocean flare pack.

Ground tackle
Rocna anchor with stainless steel chain and warp.

Manufacturer Provided Description
The Voyage 500 is a luxury charter and bluewater cruising catamaran. Its wide beam offers stability, comfort and exceptional space. The large cockpit area is shaded by a hardtop bimini. The Charter layout includes four queen-size en suite cabins, a crew cabin and day head, a gourmet galley up, and a large saloon and bar counter that allows for entertaining eight guests in comfort. The Owners layout designates the entire starboard hull to the owner offering a desk area, a separate head / shower, and ample cupboard space. All aspects of the design and finish emphasize durability, low maintenance, and safety.


Additional Information

Layout and Accommodations
5 cabin/5 head layout
Large salon and galley up
Fully air-conditioned
Alcantara upholstered settee

U-Line Ice Maker
Standing height throughout 1.9m or 6'2”
Storage under seating
7 white Hella Turbo fans (port fwd, port aft, starboard fwd, starboard midship, galley, salon, pilot berth)
Lights with dimmers, courtesy lights, spreader lights, boom lights and 12v outlets
Sound system - 12v Radio/CD with 6 speakers in salon, mast and cockpit. Toshiba TV
Chart table with recessed chart stowage
Access panels to electrical installation and systems at instrument console and navigation seat
2 guest cabins with heads on port side and starboard side (4 total) l / 1 queen cabin mid ship with head


Sizeable locker at foot of the bunk

Back rests above cabin seats
Numerous lights with dimmers in main salon, galley and cockpit

headroom:

FORWARD HEAD COMPARTMENT
Accessed through fore-cabin only for privacy.
One-piece moulded head compartment for good water tightness and easy maintenance:
• Separate shower with curved pivoting plexiglass shower door.

• Hot and cold mixer tap.

• Opening deck hatch (10.2"x10.2") with Oceanair combination screen/privacy curtain..

COMPANIONWAY
The salon companionway is in wood with suspended molded wood treads covered with non-slip surface. For safety, it has four stainless steel handrails, two of which are leather trimmed, and is removable and supported by a gas strut to access the engine compartment.

SALON
Chart table starboard:

GALLEY TO PORT
The U-shaped galley is located by the companionway.

AFT CABIN

Accommodations & Layout:


Port hull from forward:

Access to storage locker followed aft by head compartment with New Jabsco Quiet Electric Heads (overboard and holding tank) and shower. The entire surface is pastel white gelcoat with rounded comers.

Aft of the head is the forward stateroom with queen-sized berth inboard with lockers forward and underneath.

Next aft is the passageway, which is where the wine refrigerator with dual temp control for red and white wines. Aft of this an ice machine and a top-loading freezer. Above the freezer is a custom, enclosed, bottle storage cabinet.

Aft cabin has inboard queen sized berth with shelves and lockers. Included in the passageway are more storage spaces. Aft head has New Jabsco Quiet Electric Heads with deluxe bowl and shower. The sole has been carpeted with blue fitted carpets.

 Up 3 steps from the port hull is the bridge deck with huge U shaped galley to port, all finished off-white Corian and featuring all rounded corners. To starboard is the U shaped dinette, which is covered in brick colored upholstery. This settee converts into a super king-sized bed (33% larger than a normal king).

 

Down three steps to the starboard hull, which is identical to port hull with the exception of an additional private single cabin in the passageway.

 There are additional ports in each cabin to increase ventilation and 10 Lewmar hatches. White removable vinyl headliners, line the entire inside of the yacht. Aft to starboard and next to the sliding companionway door is the sit down nav station. There is easy access to the back of the electric panel and instrumentation. The entire interior is very bright and airy, with pastel white surfaces, white headliners and beech trim. The dining table is a custom maple table.

 

The yacht has been fitted with independent Dometic air conditioners in each cabin, independently controlled 6000 BTU units and a 12000BTU unit in the galley, which also cools the salon

Swish has been fitted with one chest deep freezer and one chest refrigerator – both 12volt. The refrigerator & freezer are operated independently.

The volume of the freezer in the port passageway is 210-L. The volume of the refrigerator in the galley is 105-L. It has controls which allows it to be switched off, used as a refrigerator or as a freezer

There are independent steering systems to each rudder – if one system shuts down, the other still performs. In addition there is an emergency tiller

 

Construction Notes:
The Hull and keel are hand laid CSM & quadraxial roving with vinylester resin cored with Tomanto PVC foam for stiffness, strength and insulation. Her keels are low aspect ratio, fin design for lift and enhanced windward performance. There are full-length skegs with elliptical rudders.

 Deck and superstructure is hand laid multi?directional glass roving molded in one piece and cored with end grain balsa. Deck to hull joint is chemically bonded.

 Cockpit has U-shaped seating with 2 full width and depth, lazarette locker, 2 shallow lockers, helm station is forward to starboard with swivel helm seat. There is a custom fiberglass dining table,

Doyle Stack-Pack mainsail storage system

Winches:

1 x Lewmar 56ST 2-speed mainsheet

2 x Lewmar 56ST 2-speed secondary

2 x Harken 48ST 2-speed primary

1 x Lewmar 44ST 2-speed, 12-volt main halyard & reefing

1 x Barlow 25CST jib halyard

Norseman and swage end fittings

Diamond stayed rigging

Babystay

Running backstays

Spinnaker halyard

Lewmar sheet & halyard stoppers

Lewmar blocks & traveler for main

 

Mechanical Equipment:
1 x 1996 Yanmar 38 HP 3JH2 engine in starboard hull – 

1 x 2013 Yanmar 38 HP 3JH5E engine in port hull – 

Yanmar SD31 sail drives w/2.14:1 reduction gears – rebuilt ‘13

3 x Racor fuel/water separators

Dual Morse single lever controls – new ‘13

2 x 3-blade props

Engines are accessed via large Lewmar overhead hatches on the deck

2 x automatic bilge pumps – one in each hull

2 x automatic bilge pumps – one in each engine room

2 x Raritan raw water strainers

2 x Whale Gusher Titan manual pumps

2 x Whale Gusher Titan bilge/holding tank pumps

4 x bilge alarms – engine rooms and main hulls w/alarms in salon – new ’05

4 x Jabsco Quiet electric heads

2 x Rule electronic bilge pump switches

All freshwater outlets in the cabins & galley are single lever mixers

2 x 6-gallon water heaters (22v/heat exchanger)

Sight gauges for all tanks

There are independent steering systems to each rudder – if one system shuts down, the other still performs. In addition there is an emergency tiller

 

Construction Notes:
The Hull and keel are hand laid CSM & quadraxial roving with vinylester resin cored with Tomanto PVC foam for stiffness, strength and insulation. Her keels are low aspect ratio, fin design for lift and enhanced windward performance. There are full-length skegs with elliptical rudders.

 Deck and superstructure is hand laid multi?directional glass roving molded in one piece and cored with end grain balsa. Deck to hull joint is chemically bonded.

 Cockpit has U-shaped seating with 2 full width and depth, lazarette locker, 2 shallow lockers, helm station is forward to starboard with swivel helm seat. There is a custom fiberglass dining table,

This boat is a 2013 build, sold in Oct 2014 and shows and looks new. It was bought from a Great Lakes dealer who kept it indoors in the winter and in fresh water for a short summer season.
AIR2AIR is Waxed Quarterly and Captain maintained.
Bottom professionally cleaned monthly
She has a 140% Genny and performance main.
Full set of fitted sheets and accessories……..the boat has never overnighted

Custom Stainless Flag holder and burgee halyard

The owner is a NYYC member and fastidious about maintenance, he has owned many boats and is selling to purchase a larger boat in the same family of Yachts & is therefore motivated to SELL.

44'   Draft: 5'6"- 8'       Beam 13'  
 

Engines: Yanmar 4JHE diesel with maxprop
 

Cruising Speed: 6.5 Max Speed: 7.4 
 

Tankage: fuel 50 gal, H2O 100 gal, holding 18 gal.
 

Cruising boat comfort with high performance hull and rig.
Triple spreader. 63' bridge clearance.

Fore and aft staterooms; master is aft with a center-line double "island" berth. Sleeps 8 in 3 cabins. Dinette is huge, the galley is spacious and efficient, plus there are two(2) heads with showers. Rich teak interior and navy blue upholstery.


 

Pressure H/C fresh water and h/w heater. Salt water valve. Seward propane stove and oven. Sea Frost refrigeration. Double SS sink.

Midland VHF. Sony CD AM/FM stereo. B&G instruments (AWI, WSI, depth, knot/log/timer w/ repeaters. 110V AC, 12V DC.

Harken Roller furling, rod rigging, Navtec hydraulic vang and backstay.

All lines lead to cockpit. Easy single-hander. Lazy jacks. Mainsail cover. Sunshade/cockpit awning. Permanent folding swim ladder.

•BALLAST: 9,000 lbs
•MAST HEIGHT: 59' 0" - ICW FRIENDLY
•HEADROOM 6' 6"

A Sea-kindly, Classic, Capable Bluewater Cruiser - She's Equally Suited
For Dockside Live-Aboard.

Below the waterline, an efficient modified full keel is designed with a
cutaway before the skegged rudder. It's a versatile configuration
offering balanced and predictable tracking, enhanced performance while
maintaining a comfortable motion at sea.  The bottom has been Interlux Barrier Coated.

Molded in to the hull are lengthwise scores to simulate planking
accenting the boats genuine profile. A heavy rub rail traces the sheer
and protects the topsides.

  • Newer Teak Side Decking -  Elastomeric Bedded Rather Than Deck Screwed
  • 3-1/2" Bulwarks - Teak Capped
  • Double Anchor Roller
  • Boarding Gates - Port & Starboard w/ A Custom Stainless Steel Ladder
  • Full Length Coach Roof Teak Handrails
  • Curved Stainless Steel Mast Guards
  • 11 - Opening Ports
  • 5 -  Opening Deck Hatches
  • 2 - Dorade Vents

Beneteau 42CC Clipper 'SeaBisc'

Accommodations

Down below, this Beneteau incorporates beautifully crafted cherry stained cabinetry and joinery. Huge overhead panoramic deck windows flood the spacious main salon with light. The gourmet galley features plenty of storage and counter space. The luxurious master suite is equipped with a centerline Queen berth, flanking settees for lounging and a built-in dressing table. The forward suite offers a Double berth w/drawer & locker underneath, hanging locker and reading lights. The forward ensuite head equally equipped as owner's head.

  • Hot/cold pressure water
  • ENO 2-burner gimbaled LPG S/S stove w/protection bar
  • 12V Refrigeration, large double door
  • Foot pump for ice box discharge & sea water,
  • Trash bin, vegetable baskets, cutlery drawer, dust pan in floor & good lighting.

Sails & Rigging

Standard in-mast furling main sail and 140% furling genoa on ProFurl system. All standing rigging and running rigging in very good condition. All rigging led aft to Cockpit for ease of sailing. Rigid Boom Vang.

  • In-mast Furling Main Sail (new 2015)
  • Roller furling Genoa in excellent condition
  • Lewmar 54 primaries winches, 40 secondary

Deck & Cockpit

Expansive aft deck with swing down swim platform, large lazarettes for storage and enclosed propane locker, Hard dodger/ opening windshield with soft dodger and bimini. The perfect deck for entertaining and enjoying. You can have 6 people on the aft deck while underway with no interference of running rigging!

The cockpit has Teak inlay in the floor and cockpit seats. A fold-up cockpit table is great while at anchor or at dock. The helm has all instrumentation at your fingertips, and an opening in the bimini allows easy view of the main sail.

  • Dodger
  • Bimini
  • Complete cockpit enclosure
  • Swing down swim platform
  • Davits

Hull:

Design, cruising performance, and comfort, all make the Catalina 42 the first choice of sailors worldwide. The hull of the 42 MkII is high volume, and easily driven, with a fine entry, firm midship section, and smooth run aft terminating in a modified reverse transom with an uncommonly spacious and functional boarding platform.

    • Water: 608 Ltr (160 Gal),

    • Interior Main Salon Upholstery (camel colored leather)
    • Black Persian Runner Rugs
    • Interior Hatch Screens

    • Anchor/deck wash down (salt)
    • Hot/cold Deck shower

    • Deck Awnings (Oyster White)2013

    • Helm Cover (Navy) 2013
    • Helm Chair Cover (Oyster White) 2013
    • Hatch Covers (Navy) 2013
    • Winch Covers (Navy) 2013

    WINCHES AND WINDLASS

title: 1969 Hinckley H-41 Competition Sloop
loa:
41'17"; LWL: 29.83'; BEAM: 10.25'; DRAFT: 6.16'; DISP: 19,000 lbs; BALLAST: 8,618 lbs (external lead)

TANKAGE:

Fuel: 34 gallons in Monel tank.

Water: 72 gallons in one S/S tank under vee berth and one fiberglass tank under cabin sole.

Holding: Lectra San unit with 2008 Jabsco manual W.C.

ENGINE & MECHANICAL:
• 2008 Yanmar 3JH4E diesel, 42 hp, 3 cylinder, FWC, with 340 hours as seen on the hour meter.
• Kanzai transmission in vee drive.
• Morse controls.
• 2012 Tides Marine dripless shaft seal.
• 3 bladed Max folding prop.
• 2012 1" S/S shaft.
• Racor fuel filter.
• Manual fuel pump to help bleed engine.
• Bilge blower.
• Rule 1100 bilge pump.
• Bronze ball valves and seacocks, all new 2008.

Cruising speed: 6.5 knots @ 2200 RPM, burning less than 1 gph.

Range: Approximately 200 NM.

ELECTRICAL: (Vessel completely rewired in 2008).
• 12V DC & 110V AC systems.
• 2008 AC-DC Blue Seas circuit breaker panels.
• 2-12V Group 31 AGM house batteries, new 2012.
• 1-12V Group 24 wet cell engine start battery (batteries located in port & starboard sail lockers).
• 2008 six gallon Force Ten hot water heater; hot water runs off AC and engine.
• One electric bilge pump (new 2016); one sump pump and engine can work as bilge pump.
• 2012 Guest galvanic isolator.
• 2008 30 amp shore power inlet with 50' 30 amp shore cord.
• 30 amp 110V outlets.
• 2008 Guest 20 amp Smart 16202 battery charger.

ELECTRONICS: (ALL NEW 2008)
• ICOM ICM-304 VHF.
• Raymarine C80 chartplotter-Radar (2kw), in Nav Pod at binnacle.
• Raymarine 4000 autopilot.
• Raymarine ST60 speed/depth.
• Raymarine ST60 wind speed and direction.
• Sony AM/FM/CD stereo with speakers in cabin and cockpit, with auxiliary input (also stereo has a remote).

ACCOMMODATIONS:
For six in a traditional Hinckley layout with 2008 Herreshoff interior. RADIO FLYER has a varnished mahogany trim and painted white bulkheads for a much brighter and lighter interior than her sisterships. With her blue-gray berth cushions with new 6" foam, and the contrasting mahogany joinerwork, she has an understated elegance. Her cabin sole is varnished solid teak and holly. As with all Hinckley’s, there are numerous drawers, lockers, liquor locker, and sliding doors to bins for food storage.
• Vee berths forward with access to a large double door to the forepeak. There is a filler piece to form a double berth, shelves outboard and drawers under. A transverse sliding pocket door provides privacy.
• Next aft to port is an enclosed head with large linen locker, S/S sink, laminate countertop, hand-held shower with hot and cold water, and a 2008 Jabsco manual head.
• There are two hanging lockers opposite to starboard.
• Next aft is the main salon with an attractive tiled Simpson-Lawrence fireplace to starboard which burns wood or briquettes.
• On centerline is the keel-stepped mast and bulkhead-mounted Mahogany dining table.
• Next, to port and starboard, are two transom berths which pull out, storage behind and under, and two pilot berths. Brass reading lights are provided, and the hull is attractively sheathed in varnished mahogany. 
• Further aft to starboard is a generous-sized icebox, with chart table above.
• The engine access is behind the removable companionway ladder.
• Further aft is an oil skin locker with the new circuit breaker panels behind.
• To port is the L-shaped galley offering a three burner LPG S/S Shipmate stove, and one S/S sink with hot and cold water.
• There are numerous dish lockers, dishes and glassware are included in this sale.
• Also included are two Carfano 12V fans.
• There are two generous-sized deck hatches and one opening port in the head, providing excellent ventilation.

SAILS & RIGGING:
• 2008 Elvstrom Sobstad Main, which is loose-footed.
• 2008 Z Sail 135% genoa (laminated radial cut).
• UK Halsey asymmetrical red, yellow, black & white spinnaker (like new-year unknown).
• Awlgripped white aluminum mast and boom with internal halyards; mast stepped on keel (mast rewired 2008).
• 2008 Selden boom and gooseneck with lazy jacks.
• S/S standing rigging checked and approved 2008; 2008 all new running rigging.
• Harken roller furler, series 2-189 for genoa.
• 1 Barient #22 halyard winch.
• 4 Barient #22 2-speed sheet winches.
• 1 Barient #30 S.T. 2-speed halyard.
• 1 Barient #30 sheet winch, aft of pedestal (all winches re-chromed 2008).
• Mainsheet traveler.
• Toast-colored Sunbrella sail covers.
• ATN "Tacker".
• 2008 new Tricolor, spreader and steaming lights.

EQUIPMENT:
• 2015 "California cockpit" Dodger-(mini bimini with three side curtains).
• Full cockpit and cabin awning (extends from the mast to the backstay) with Forespar telescoping poles.
• Xintex Fireboy Propane/CNG fume detector in bilge under stove.
• Ideal windlass (completely rebuilt 2015).
• Fortress FX37 anchor with 20' 3/8" chain & 150' 5/8" rode.
• 35 lb CQR Plow on roller with 50' 1/2" chain and 200' 3/4" rode.
• Ensign and staff.
• 8 fenders; docklines.
• Fenderboard.
• Swim ladder.
• Two LPG bottles are housed in a varnished teak vented locker with solenoid, regulator, and pressure gauge.
• Life jackets; lifesling.
• 2012 gold closed-cell cockpit cushions.
• 2008 Tricolor light at masthead.
• Two boat hooks; 1 bell.
• Portable searchlight.
• 2008 Manual Whale gusher pump.
• Toast-colored Sunbrella pedestal cover and hatch covers, and covers for fore and aft decks.
• Leeboards available, but not installed.

COMMENTS: RADIO FLYER is a Hinckley 41' "Competition" sloop which is in first class condition having benefited from a complete restoration in 2007-2008 by her fastidious owner. Now, after nine years of enjoyment, her owners are looking to purchase a larger liveaboard vessel. These "Competition" 41's are well-known as the best performers of the Hinckley fleet. Please review the listing above to thoroughly understand the work that was performed. We also have a survey and full description of all the upgrades which we will send to interested parties. We shall be pleased to make arrangements for your inspection of this outstanding "Classic" Hinckley Sloop. You will not be disappointed. Thank you for your interest.

displacement:
24,500 lbs         Ballast: 7,700 lbs
Sail area: Main-343 sq.ft.         Genoa-465 sq.ft.
SA/Disp: 15.8                           Air-Draft: 55'

Sails and Rigging
Fully-battened Main Sail
155% genoa (cleaned/repaired 2013)
Schaefer 1100 furling system for genoa
(2) Lewmar #42 winches
(1) Lewmar #16 ST winches
(2) Barlow #20 winches
(2) Lewmar #8 winches
Aluminum spars, spinnaker/reacher pole on mast-track -??
Stainless steel standing rigging, 1x19 wire
Windex at top of mast
 
Mechanical and Engine Equipment
Westerbeke 4-cyl Diesel   (40 HP)
Paragon Transmission w/ Walter V-Drive
Hours: 3400 (reported)
Dual Racor R25T fuel filters
Water heater: 6 gal, 110AC or engine heat-exchanger
Refleks Diesel Heater
Wheel steering (40 dia) w/Emergency tiller
Sailomat Windvane
Lavac Toilet in large head


Electrical and Electronics
12VDC bank w/ Link 10 monitor      
(4) 6Volt G-24 (222 Ah)          Starter (1) amps     ???
Iota 12V battery charger (55Amp)
Xantrex XS400 Inverter (400 watt)
Kenwood TS430s SSB Radio
Icom M25 VHF radio (25W)
Kenwood Stereo with CD
2 bilge pumps, auto and manual

Hull / Deck / Safety Gear
2) 35 lb. Bruce Claw Anchors w/ chain n rode
Simpson Lawrence 555 Windlass
Navigation lights, w/ tricolor                - ?
Bow pulpit & stern pushpit
Side stanchions with lifelines
Fenders and dock lines
Fabric dodger, main-sail cover

Galley Notes
3 -Burner LPG Hillertange w/ oven
Top-loading insulated large Ice box
Double stainless-steel sink
Hot & cold pressure water
Raw water w/ foot-pump

Tanks
Fuel               75 Gal. Aluminum
Water             90 Gal. 2) SS tanks
Waste              6 Gal. polytank

make-model: YORKTOWN   CENTER COCKPIT BLUEWATER OFFSHORE SAILING YACHT   GREAT OPPORTUNITY
title: 1979 Yorktown - Center Cockpit Bluewater Offshore Sailing Yacht - Great Opportunity

headroom:
6’ 8"

Tanks

  • Diesel Fuel: 35 gal.
  • Fresh Water: 119 gal.
  • Holding: 24 gal.

Accommodations

ARRIBA has been well kept. Pride of ownership cannot be overlooked when you first step aboard. Upon entering via the companionway the condition of the cabinetry, soft goods and sole appear to be that of a younger vessel. The 3 cabin layout is both practical and inviting. Directly aft to port and starboard of the companionway stairs are guest berths with hanging lockers. Forward of the port berth is the Nav Station with storage, VHF, Stereo and electrical panel. Forward of the starboard berth is a head w/shower. The fully appointed galley continues along the starboard side with a comfortable U-shaped settee across to port. If needed, the settee can be converted to a double berth. A private owners stateroom with built-in seating, hanging locker and large head is forward of the galley and settee.

Interior Details

  • 3 Cabin
  • 2 Heads
  • Sleeping for 8
  • A/C, Cruisair, Model SLXR12 - (2) - 12,000 BTU
  • Generous Natural Light w/Cross Ventilation
  • Fans
  • Window Covering, Curtains
  • Hatch Shades

Galley

  • Starboard Side
  • Formica Counter & Cabinet Storage
  • Refrigeration/Freezer, Adler Barbour, Top Load
  • Range & Oven, Force 10 Gimballed Two Burner
  • Microwave, Origo
  • Double Stainless Sink w/Hot & Cold Pressure Single Lever

Head(s)

  • Toilets, Jabsco Manual
  • Single Sink
  • Shower

Electronics & Navigation

Nav Station

  • VHF, Standard Horizon, MATRIX AIS/GPS (Dec 2014)
  • Stereo, Sony, Model CDX-CA705M, w/Interior & Cockpit Speakers

Helm Station

  • Chart Plotter, Raymarine E80 w/U.S. Chip & Mid-Atlantic Platinum Chip
  • Auto-Pilot, Raymarine ST6001
  • Raymarine ST60 Wind
  • Raymarine ST60 TRIDATA, Depth, Speed, Trip
  • Magnetic Compass, Plastimo
  • VHF, Standard Horizon, RAM 3 (Dec 2014)
  • Instruments Networked via SeaTalk

Mechanical

  • Diesel, Volvo, 40 H.P.,  997.5 Hours (As of Jan 2017)
  • Propeller, Feathering Max Prop
  • Racor Fuel/Water Separator
  • Sound insulated engine compartment w/access from front, sides and rear

Electric & Plumbing

  • Batteries, Start 1 (Jun 2016), House 2 6-Volt (Sep 2015)
  • Battery Charger, 40 Amp.
  • 12V Electrical Panel
  • 30 Amp Shore Power Cord, 2
  • 12V Lighting Fixtures
  • Water Heater, Atwood, 6 Gallon, Model EHM6-SM
  • Pressure water system with hot and cold water tap in galley and heads.
  • Electric bilge pump w/auto switch
  • Manual bilge pump

Sails, Rigging & Hardware

  • Deck-stepped anodized aluminum mast with stainless steel support post inside saloon
  • 2 Sets of Aft-Swept Spreaders
  • Rigid Boom Vang, Adjustable From Cockpit
  • In-Mast Furling
  • Head-Sail Furler
  • Sail, Jib,  (April 2016)
  • Sail, Main, (April 2016)
  • Gennaker w/Sock, Doyle, Good Condition
  • Winches, Lewmar 48 ST (2), Lewmar 30 (1)
  • Winch handles

Deck

  • Bimini
  • Wheel Steering
  • Helm Cover
  • Double lifelines w/quick release hooks
  • Welded s/s double bow rail & stem rail, stanchions
  • Cockpit Table, Teak
  • Transom Shower, Hot/Cold
  • Swim Ladder

Anchoring & Safety

  • Windlass, Simpson Lawrence, Horizon 1500
  • Anchor, Delta 35 w/Nylon & Chain Rode

title: 1988 CAL 39
displacement:
18000 Draft: 5'6" Ballast: 8000

 
Engine:
Yanmar  44 HP Engine Model: 4-JHE

 

Tankage:
Fuel: 38 gal. aluminum Water: 100 Holding: 20

 

Accommodations

She sleeps 6 people comfortably. The master stateroom can be either forward or aft, each unit has a queen berth. Features include drapes, cushions, spacious v-berth forward with separate vanity, shelf and drawers, storage and a large hanging locker. Aft is the main salon with skylights and hatches that provide a bright, well-lit interior. Aft cabin is large with ample storage and hanging lockers. Custom pull-out converts port settee to a generous berth. Four opening ports and 1 overhead hatch provide ventilation and light. Large head is to port with a separate shower stall.

 


Galley

The galley is very spacious with an Alder5 Barbour refrigeration, Force 10 3- burner stove w/oven and microwave, water heater and pressure water. The galley is to starboard and provides ample storage with s/s sinks and large refrig.,/ice box.

 


Sails

Main

Genoa #1

Genoa #2

1.5 oz Spinnaker w/sock

.75 oz Spinnaker

Jib

Storm Jib

Spinnaker Staysail

 


Electronics/Navigation:

Raymarine Autopilot, compass Raymarine depth sounder, Radar-(Raytheon) 20xx mounted on cockpit bracket, VHF, wind speed, rudder angle indicator, Clarion radio-Stereo/Stereo CD, Garmin 196 w/external antenna mounted on davit, GPS (wheel mounted), pedestal compass, new speed and depth gauges are still boxed and go with boat.

 


Electrical:

3 batteries

Battery charger

Dockside electric

Battery parallel switch

110 and 12 v electrical system

Kenyon inverter 1500 watts

High input alternator (120 amps) w/Alpha 3 step regulator

12 V starting battery

1.6 Volt house batteries (l-16 group) 350 amps

 

 


Hull and Deck:

Custom teak cockpit table

Custom bow roller

Additional anchors and rode

Fortress FX37

Delto 35

Oversized locker w/deck hatch

2 propane tanks

Rail mounted BBQ grill

6 person life raft w/hydrostaic release and grad

Bow pulpit and lines

Boarding ladder

Transom docking lights

Swim Platform

Features include drapes, cushions, spacious v-berth forward with separate vanity, shelf and drawers, storage and a large hanging locker. Aft is the main salon with skylights and hatches that provide a bright, well-lit interior. Aft cabin is large with ample storage and hanging lockers. Custom pull-out converts port settee to a generous berth. Four opening ports and 1 overhead hatch provide ventilation and light. Large head is to port with a separate shower stall.

 


Galley

The galley is very spacious with an Alder5 Barbour refrigeration, Force 10 3- burner stove w/oven and microwave, water heater and pressure water. The galley is to starboard and provides ample storage with s/s sinks and large refrig.,/ice box.

Engine Brand: Perkins
Engine Model: 4.108
Engine/Fuel Type: Diesel
Engine Hours: 1842
Propeller: Folding propeller

Accommodations
Number of cabins: 3
Number of heads: 2

Vessel Walkthrough

This boat has a nice clean interior with light wood bulkheads and trim. This 3-cabin layout has two spacious aft cabins each with good storage. Between each, below the cockpit and behind the companionway stairs is a small head compartment which can be accessed from each cabin by a door. The aft section of this compartment has a door which allows engine access. The galley is to port of the companionway and the nav table is to starboard. The galley is separated from the salon by a partial bulkhead. The salon has a straight settee to starboard, with storage behind. Along the centerline of the boat is a fold-down table with leaves that reach each settee when extended. The U-shaped settee on the port side has a pilot berth behind it. Forward of the salon is a head to port and a storage locker to starboard. The V-berth is spacious with standing room at the door and good storage.

  – 3X house batteries
  – 1X start battery
  – 1X anchor windlass battery
  – 3X battery volt/amp meters
  – Truecharge 20+amp battery charger
  – 2x 30amp shore power cords
  – 4 AC outlets, 2 DC outlets

Galley

  – ENO 3 burner gimballed LPG cooktop and stove
  – Adler Barbour Fridge Freezer - top load with foot pump
  – Double s/s sinks
  – 6 Gallon water heater
  – Pressurized water
  – Sea water foot pump

Tanks

Fresh Water: 100-gallons (2 x 50-gallon bladder)

Holding: bladder style - on board but not hooked up

  – Spinnaker pole (port foredeck)
  – 2 x Lewmar 48 primary winches
  – 2 x Lewmar 46 secondary winches
  – 3 x Lewmar winches on cabin top
  – Dodger
  – Teak Cockpit grating
  – Teak cockpit seats
  – Fold-down teak cockpit table
  – Drinks holders on the pedestal

Sails and Rigging

  – Genoa 145% roller furling -VERY good condition - Quantum sails
  – Blade (jib) - like new NEVER USED
  – Storm Jib like new NEVER USED
  – Adjustable hydraulic backstay
  – Running backstays
  – All lines led to cockpit

  – Nexus Wind Instrument

  – VHF: Standard Horizon INTREPID+

    * Full-batten, Triple-reef Doyle Cruise Laminate MainSail

    * Stainless Steel Rod Rigging
    * Running Rigging: Dacron Yacht-braid lines
    * Barient Winches; 2)#32s, 2)#22s, 1)#23ST, #18, #10

Mechanical and Engine Equipment
    * 30HP Yanmar 3QM diesel engine, fresh water cooled
    * Paragon V-drive and PYI Drip-less Stuffing box
    * Stainless steel 1.125 Shaft, 3-Blade Prop w/ Cutlass Bearing
    * Dual Racor Filters, 30 micron, 2 micron secondary w/ gauge
    * 6 gal) Isotemp Hot-water Heater, 110AC/Heat-exchanger

Electrical and Electronics
    * House:  2)6VDC T105 and 1) 4d Dyno Batteries (405AmpHrs)
    * Start:  12VDC Group 27 Dyno 27M (100AmpHrs)

    * Paneltronics AC/DC Panel, Guest Switches, 90Amp Alternator
    * Wallas 30D diesel forced air heating System w/ day tank
    * Alpine AM/FM/CD player w/ Bluetooth

Instruments
    * Furuno 1621 Radar, swing-out display
    * I60 Wind, Speed, Depth Instruments
    * Raymarine X-10 belowdeck Autopilot
       Electro-Linear drive w/ ST70 Head
    * Standard Horizon VHF w/ AIS receiver
    * Standard Horizon CPF300i Chartplotter
    * Pedestal w/ Richie Compass

Galley | Interior Gear
    * 3-Burner NZ Mariner Propane Stove

D E S I G N & H I S T O R Y, OVERVIEW OF THE MODEL, NOT TO BE CONTRUED AS EXACT SPEC FOR THIS PARTICULAR LISTING, OFFERED AS INFORMATION ONLY !

In 1981, Endeavour commissioned Johann Valentijn to design, what would be his first production cruiser for an American client: the Endeavour 38. The Endeavour 38 was introduced for the 1984 sailing season.
Although unverified, the E38 apparently was offered with two differrnet keel depths, which may have been an option on later model boats. Our understanding is that there is a shallow but longer keel  which is the original documented design by Johan Valentijn, which was stretched aft towards the prop, and a deeper but narrower keel which would provide better windward performance.

 

H U L L&D E C K

According to Johann Valentijn, ". . . the HULL has a medium displacement for its waterline length. The section shape forward is a soft "V" that goes into an almost flat bottom amidships for increased stability and span for the keel. Aft the sections stay flat and full with straight diagonals. The keel sections are developed from systematic testing that was done on America's Cup Contenders. . . ."
Construction of the hull consists of GRP with a 3/4" klegecell core. The inside and outside shell have a minimum thickness of 1/4" solid fiberglass each in the bottom and slightly less in the topsides. The interior bulkheads are glassed in and form part of the total structure. The keel areas, maststep, chainplates and engine beds are made with a special steel structure to increase strength and stiffness of those highly loaded areas.
 
The Klegecell gives the boat a light, stiff but strong hull which kept the center of gravity down low. This in turn allowed a very full interior and a stable boat that can carry a large rig quite easily. The Endeavour 38 used a large steel grid glassed into the hull.

 

R U D D E R&S T E E R I N G

The Rudder is molded as a single piece of solid high density foam with a protective skin of fiberglass and gelcoat finish. The rudder post, which is molded integrally inside the rudder, is solid stainless steel and is welded to a steel blade in the interior of the rudder. The high lift skeg-mounted rudder provides hands off tracking and ease of steering.
A pedestal steering system is installed and operates with stainless steel cables rotating a radial quadrant bolted and keyed to the rudder post. The cables run from the radial quadrant to idler sheaves beneath the pedestal and then up into the pedestal where they are shackled to a stainless steel chain running over a sprocket on the steering wheel shaft.

 

S P A R S&R I G G I N G

The rig is a sloop rig and the aspect ratio of both the fore triangle and the main sail is chosen to give maximum performance for a given sail area.
All spars (mast, booms and spreaders) are extruded aluminum 6061-T6 alloy with a protective anodized coating on all external surfaces. The mast is stepped through the cabin overhead onto the steel grid's compression frame which is bonded and mechanically attached to the keel.
The forestay attaches to the stemhead fitting at the bow. All other stays and shrouds are attached to chainplates at the deck. Chainplates are either stainless steel straps through bolted to heavy structural bulkheads, in the case of the upper and intermediate shrouds, or stainless tie rods, I the case of the lower shrouds. All standing rigging is attached to chainplates with adjustable turnbuckles.
All halyards are pre-stretched jacketed Dacron line to minimize stretch and maximize service life. All halyards are run internally in the mast.

 

I N T E R I O R

The interior of the Aft-Cockpit E38 is built up of wood. A framework of 3/8" plate steel is constructed and placed in the bilge and heavily bonded in place with woven roving. A plywood sole is glued and screwed on top of the steel grid and bonded to the hull. All subsole wood is saturated with polyester resin to seal all exposed grain. The sole is Teak & Holly.
The interior is well laid out. As you descend into the main cabin, the galley is to starboard with a large settee forward. On the opposite side of the boat, a double berth is tucked under the cockpit for privacy, a curtain can be drawn. The nav station is just forward of the berth and faces a large L-shaped settee around the dining table. The main bulkhead runs across the boat at the mast and carries some of the rigging load. Forward of this bulkhead is a large head with a separate shower stall. Opposite the head are hanging lockers and a vanity with a large comfortable V-berth in the forepeak.
On the E38 Aft-Cockpit there are 15 opening ports with screens and 6 opening deck hatches.

 

E L E C T R I C A LÂ .Â .S Y S T E M

All wiring is plastic coated 10 gauge stranded cooper with crimp type connectors used alt all junctions or terminals. All DC wiring is two wire, color coded: red (positive) and yellow (negative. Battery cables are: red (positive) and black (negative). All AC wiring is three wire, color coded: black (hot), white (AC common) and green (case grounded).
Metallic fittings below the water line are electrically bonded together with green coasted 8 gauge copper wire and connected to a common ships ground.
The DC system is powered by two 12-volt batteries connected in parallel.

title: 1982 MAXI YACHTS 108
displacement:
13,000   Draft: 6'6    Bridge Clearance: 53'
Ballast: 5,500
 
Engine(s): Volvo Engine(s) HP: 25 Engine Model: MD-11D
Cruising Speed: 6 kts Max Speed: 7 kts
 

Tankage
 Fuel: 32 gals  Water: 45 gals  Holding: 10 gals

 


Accommodations and Layout
 Triangle-shaped double berth forward with custom innerspring mattress, large overhead hatch and ample stowage. Aft ro salon with inline galley port side, raised C-shaped dinette across starboard. Continue aft to head on port side, centerline companionway with nav table starboard. Aft of nav table is LONG sea berth in companionway aft to stateroom with second companionway to cockpit.
Note interior is unblemished teak throughout, soft goods have been tastefully renewed, 6'2 headroom throughout.


 


Galley and Head
 Double stainless steel sinks with hot/cold pressure water (hot water heater 110V and engine fired), two burner propane stove with oven, 110V refrigerated ice box. Manual pump head, handheld shower.

 


Electronics and Navigation Equipment
 Sitex T-721 radar,  Autohelm 3000 autopilot, Horizon speed/log/depth, Raytheon VHF radio, Garmin GPSMA{472 Chart Plotter, binnacle mounted magnetic compass; . AM/FM/CD stereo with speakers.

 


Electrical System
 110V AC / 12V DC. Thirty amp shorepower service, battery charger and inverter, three batteries in two banks.

 


Sails and Rigging
 Keel-stepped double spreader aluminum mast, Fully battened Dacron main sail with Dutchman system, 135 Genoa, spinnaker and pole, Furlex roller furler,  Hydraulic backstay adjuster, stainless steel standing rigging, running rigging with all lines lead aft thru labeled rope clutches.

 

Deck and Hull
 Awlgripped  hull with fin keel and skeg-hung rudder, cored decks, substantial rubber rub rail around entire hull. Large, comfortable cockpit with high coamings.
Stainless steel bow pulpit, stainless steel stanchions with double lifelines. Sunbrella Dodger and Bimini.


Mechanical Equipment and Engine Details
 Two cylinder Volvo diesel with sail drive.  Wheel cable and quadrant steering with emergency tiller. Electric and manual bilge pumps.

 Awlgripped  hull with fin keel and skeg-hung rudder, cored decks, substantial rubber rub rail around entire hull. Large, comfortable cockpit with high coamings.
Stainless steel bow pulpit, stainless steel stanchions with double lifelines. Sunbrella Dodger and Bimini.


Mechanical Equipment and Engine Details
 Two cylinder Volvo diesel with sail drive.  Wheel cable and quadrant steering with emergency tiller. Electric and manual bilge pumps.

Fuel: 20 gallon Water: 80 gallon Holding: 35 gallon

Accommodations

She accommodates 6 in a cabin with rich varnished teak including a teak and holly sole. Beautiful bulkhead mounted dining table, six opening ports and two hatches all with screens. U shaped galley with 3 burner propane stove. Hot and cold water with new hot water heater.

Cape Dory woodworkers have crafted teak and select hardwoods to create a warm, spacious interior, tastefully accented with a teak and holy sole. All interior cushions were replaced in 2003 with teal color Ultra-suede fabric.  The finish on all cabinetry is varnished.

All hatches, ports and companionway have screens.

A comfortable living area in the main cabin includes settee berths port and starboard with storage above.  The port settee extends inboard to form a double berth.  A bulkhead mounted dining table is to port.  There is an overhead Bomar hatch and 6 opening Spartan ports for excellent ventilation.

Aft of the main cabin is a U shaped Galley to port.  The stove has been upgraded to a 3 burner propane unit with an oven.  A large ice box is aft in the galley, and twin sinks are forward, served by hot and cold pressure water.  Ample lockers outboard of the counters allow for great storage.

To starboard is a navigation table, with space for mounting electronics and storing navigation books, toolsÂ and charts.  Aft of the nav station is a spacious quarter berth.

Forward of the main cabin is the head area to port, and hanging lockers to starboard.  The enclosed head area features ample cabinets for toiletries and towels, a hamper, shower with hot and cold pressure water, and a wash basin. The marine toilet is connected to a 35 gal. holding tank.

By abandoning the traditional V-berth concept, Cape Dory designers have been able to create a spacious forward stateroom with a large portside berth which converts to a double, a reading settee, bureau, hanging locker, and overhead shelves.  2 Spartan opening bronze ports and an overhead Bomar hatch provide excellent ventilation.

Forward of the main cabin is the head area to port, and hanging lockers to starboard.  The enclosed head area features ample cabinets for toiletries and towels, a hamper, shower with hot and cold pressure water, and a wash basin. The marine toilet is connected to a 35 gal. holding tank.

By abandoning the traditional V-berth concept, Cape Dory designers have been able to create a spacious forward stateroom with a large portside berth which converts to a double, a reading settee, bureau, hanging locker, and overhead shelves.  2 Spartan opening bronze ports and an overhead Bomar hatch provide excellent ventilation.

Accommodations
The smoked hatch entryway opens to a spacious interior which sleeps 7. A double stateroom forward and double quarterberth aft separates couples or families with children for complete privacy. The main salon features large starboard and portside  settees with a pilot berth tucked to port and liquor locker to starboard. Teak and holly sole throughout. Forward is the enclosed head with vanity and hot and cold shower. The centrally located drop-leaf table stores vertically or removes easily for racing. The portside L-shaped galley at the base of the companionway steps stands apart with a tilt-up chopping table and custom tilt-out storage locker for dishes and utensils. Just opposite, the nav station is located for quick cockpit access and features an opening chart table, bookshelf, tube storage and space for full electronics.

Engines

Engine(s): Yanmar

Hours: 176

 

Tankage

Fuel: 45 gallon
Water: 90 gallon
Holding: 25 gallon

Accommodations

Island Time is very clean and appointed very tastefully.  Starting forward there is a double pullman berth to port and storage to starboard and a privacy door. Next aft to port is the head with hot and cold shower and marine head with holding tank.

The salon, which features Island Packet's signature bulkhead mounted table, has facing settees (which have loads of storage both behind and underneath). The nav station is on the aft end of the port settee.

To starboard of the companionway is the u-shaped galley and to port is the separate aft cabin with storage and a queen sized berth.



Glebe Creek teak overhead screens for all hatches
Custom upholstry in all cabins
Custom curtains and screens for ports
Hella Fans
Overhead outside canvas for hatches, keeping the sun from bleaching the interior and protecting the hatches themselves


Galley
The U-shaped galley affords a wonderful food preparation area and good storage.
Frigoboat refrigeration/freezer
Hillerange two burner stove with oven
Double bowl stainless steel sink
Hot and cold pressurized water
Faucet filtration system
Microwave oven


Sails & Rigging

Mast inspected 2013
Cutter rigged, allowing more versatility and safety in nasty weather
Hoyt self vanging boom
All furling lines led to cockpit
Full battened mainsail with Dutchman flaking system
Harken furlers on headsail and staysail2 winch handles
Boom Vang
Stainless Steel Wire Rigging
4 Self Tailing Winches
Keel Stepped Mast

The salon, which features Island Packet's signature bulkhead mounted table, has facing settees (which have loads of storage both behind and underneath). The nav station is on the aft end of the port settee.

To starboard of the companionway is the u-shaped galley and to port is the separate aft cabin with storage and a queen sized berth.



Glebe Creek teak overhead screens for all hatches
Custom upholstry in all cabins
Custom curtains and screens for ports
Hella Fans
Overhead outside canvas for hatches, keeping the sun from bleaching the interior and protecting the hatches themselves

beam:
10.9 ft (3.33 m)
Draft: 5.2 ft (1.60 m)
Keel: Fixed keel
Material: Fiberglass
Weight: 10584 US pounds (4800 Kg)
Rigging: Sloop
Sail area: 570.28 ft² (53 m²)

Engine: Yanmar Marine : 3GM
Horsepower: 1x 27 horses (Diesel)
Engine hours: 1300 Hrs
Transmission: Line shaft

Water capacity: 39.6 US gal (150 l)
Fuel capacity: 21.1 US gal (80 l)
Number of cabins (except salon): /
Number of washrooms: /
Number of main berths: /
Number of secondary berths: /

 

Configuration

Interior from forward :
V-berth, Head to port and hanging lockers to starboard, L-shaped main salon settee to port, starboard settee and folding salon table, lU-shaped galley aft to starboard, nav station to port with seat, wide quarterberth to port.

Galley and equipmentsMain cabin

U-shaped galley with new (2012) Force-10 2-burner propane gymballed stove with oven/broiler. Icebox, manual fresh (filtered) and saltwater pumps at sink, large pantry locker, large spice rack/food locker, drawer for utensils.

L-shaped settee to port opens into large double berth. Both settees have clever backrests that shift to become leeboards, providing extra wide sea berths. Table on centerline with 2 folding tops and wine storage. Large storage shelves and lockers behind settees. New headliners.

SecurityEngine

6 life jackets, jacklines, 3 inflatable harnesses, horseshoe buoy, 2 fire extinguishers, flares, smoke signals, transom boarding ladder, horn, 2 handheld VHFs.

Low hours on the relatively new (2005) Yanmar 27 HP turning a new (2013) Kiwi 3-blade feathering prop, High-output alternator, Many spares.

ElectronicsElectrical system

Fix-mount VHF with new masthead antenna, (2) handheld VHFs, (2) Simrad tillerpilots, Depth sounder (2015), 1000W inverter with USB plugs (2014), AM/FM stereo with 6-CD changer,

120 Amp high-output alternator with Balmar smart charger, spare alternator, 220 Ah deep-cycle in (2) 6-volt golf-cart Trojan batteries (2012), (1) starter battery, battery switch, (1) 120W solar panel, LED anchor and cabin lights. Tricolor masthead light.

DeckSails and rigging

Deck completely refinished 2013 includes: new paint, new antiskid, all fittings recaulked, new chainplates, older standing rigging replaced, New teak toerails, new Maxwell chain/rope windlass, all lines led aft to cabintop clutches, (6) winches incl (2) ST Andersen primaries, (2) bulkhead compasses, new genoa lead cars. Davits.

UK dacron main (2013),
UK 130% dacron genoa (2014) on harken roller furling,
UK Symmetrical Spinnaker (2015) with new pole and rigging,
Heavy #1 jib,
New main and jib halyards (2015), all new sheets (2015).

Additional equipmentMaintenance

(3) anchors, 80' chain spliced to 200' rope, Removable dinghy davits with hoisting tackle, canvas dodger, bimini top, mainsail cover with lazy-jacks, 120W solar panel

Recently (2013-2014) overhaul includes : new topside paint, complete rebedding of all deck hardware and ports, new antiskid and cabintop paint, new multi-season antifouling bottom paint (Oct 2015), new mast wiring including new tricolor light, deck/steaming lightsand VHF antenna. All teak replaced/refinished, new rope clutches.

ELECTRONICS:
• Danforth binnacle compass.
• Raymarine C90W Radar-GPS-Plotter.
• Datamarine ST 40 wind speed and direction, depth & speed log.
• Autohelm autopilot.
• ICOM M302 VHF.



SAILS & RIGGING:
• 393 sq. ft. sail area.
• Cat Ketch rig with unstayed wooden spars.
• Mainmast is varnished spruce, built using hollow box construction.
• Mizzen is original Honduras mahogany and is built using hollow box construction.  
• Wooden laminated curved wishbone booms.
• All halyards are led aft.
• 2008 Doyle main and mizzen, in excellent condition.
• Spinlock rope clutches at cockpit.
• Lazy jacks on mast to boom.
• Barient #10 S.T. on cabin top.
• New Lewmar S.T. halyard winch.
• New outhaul system for main and mizzen.
• Slab reefing for main and mizzen.
• New mast skirts over mast partners.



EQUIPMENT:
• Lofrans manual anchor winch.
• 35 lb Plow anchor with 50' 3/8" anchor chain and 100' rode.
• Saltwater anchor/deck washdown system.
• 12 gallon propane bottle in vented locker.
• Water filters and spares.
• Boat hook; 4 docklines.
• 2 life jackets.
• Emergency tiller.
• 4 fenders with new fleece covers.
• Manual bilge pump.
• Removable solar panel on cabin top, plugs into cockpit receptacle.
• 4 fire extinguishers.
• Cockpit cushions.
• Sail covers are light gray Sunbrella.
• Swim ladder.
• Box for stowing drop boards.
• Cockpit grate.
• Flare kit.
• Masthead tricolor light.
• Forespar vent with fan.
• Aft cabin counter storage box.
• 4 pull out storage boxes.



COMMENTS: Have you been searching for a sailing vessel which is large enough to cruise in style, but easy to singlehand? Look no further than this Classic 31' Herreshoff Cat Ketch. Finally, a vessel which is simple to sail with no sheet winches, travelers, vangs, shrouds, or headsails. She is a light displacement, easily driven hull with fin keel and rudder on a skeg. She also is stiff and dry and well-balanced. She self tacks quickly and either sail may be reefed, or the boat sailed on one sail alone. Reefing lines lead to cockpit. Sails are loose-footed.
PUFFIN has an unusually spacious cabin for her 31', built with standing headroom and a cabin for five. The interior is varnished pine, fir and teak for a warm, cozy feeling. Her Yanmar engine provides reliable power when needed. Please call us for an inspection of this modern "Classic" cruising vessel. Her shoal draft, spacious cockpit, wide safe decks and easy Cat Ketch Rig make her a dream to sail. Thank you for your interest.

Accommodations/Layout
Sleeps 6 with forward v-berth, port settee that converts to double berth, port quarter berth and starboard settee berth with leecloth; blue interior cushions; athwartships head with hanging locker; ss sink with fresh water foot pump; top loading ice box, 2 burner Origo alcohol stove; varnished teak interior, brass reading lamps, generous storage, navigation table; bulkhead mounted dining table; magazine rack; and curtains.


Deck/Hull
White fiberglass hull, deck, and nonskid. Generous port, starboard, and lazarette storage. Green cove stripe. Blue boot stripe. Forward deck anchor locker. Double liflines, swim ladder. Teak toe rails, hatch trim, coamings, and locker dropboards. 2 opening ports (new), 2 solar vents, and 2 deck hatches.


Electronics
Ritchie SNF44 binnacle compass
Datamarine speed, depth, knotlog
VHF radio 
AM/FM/CD player with 4 speakers

Mainsail with lazyjacks and double reef points
Roller furling
130% genoa
working jib
Sta-set X halyards
Harken main sheet traveler

#8 Lewmar halyard winches
sheets and winch handles

Wheel steering with guard and brake
Emergency tiller
Manual head with holding tank and overboard discharge
Rule bilge pump
Manual cockpit bilge pump

title: 1983 Sam L. Morse Bristol Channel Cutter BCC28
1981 Southern Cross Cutter
displacement:
8200 pound
Ballast: 3400 pound

Tankage
Fuel: 16 gallon
Water: 55 gallons
Holding: 10 gallon

Accommodations

Factory finished teak interior and very clean.
V berth forward; head next aft on port side; opposing settee berths in main cabin.  Dining table folds to bulkhead for storage,  Navigation station near the companionway. Storage lockers and shelves. Cabin headroom 6'2"
Head with vanity and sink, hot and cold pressure water, shower and a self contained Type IIIMSD toilet system
Galley sink, icebox, (2) burner alcohol cooking surface; pressure water system
Stereo cassette and  CD


Electrical:
12 volt DC power; (3) batteries '12; battery parallel switch
12 volt Charger
110 volt AC powr; Shore power cord
Interior and navigation lights


Mechanical:
Automatic bilge pump; manual bilge pump
CO2 Fire extinguisher
Tiller steering


Navigation:
Garmin Radar/GPS-Mp500/700 Series w/ Echo Map
Depth Sounder
Ritchie Compass
Digital speed/log
VHF Radio
Masthead wind fly


Deck:
Anchor with chain and rode
Newer dinghy and motor
(6) Fenders; (1) Life Ring; Dock lines; Life jackets
Swim ladder
Bimini Top and Dodger
Spare tiller


Sails and Rigging:
All sails are Tanbark Dacron and serviced yearly-
Mainsail- new 2015 fully battened with Lazy Jacks
Headsail-Roller furling Tanbark
Staysail-new 2016, hank on
Running rigging replaced in 2015-2016 by New England Yacht Rigging
Deck stepped mast and  2 Meisner #16 winchs and 2 Meisner #24

HULL CONSTRUCTION

Solid FRP hull in full keel / attached rudder configuration. Exterior finish is white gelcoat with blue boot stripe and gold-leaf cove stripe


DECK CONSTRUCTION

Laminated White Oak carlins and deck beams overlaid with marine plywood and covered with Dynel cloth set in epoxy. Deck surface / finish is Pearl Gray Awlgrip paint in both smooth and nonskid areas. Flush deck self draining anchor locker.


DECK HOUSE CONSTRUCTION

Deck house is in the coveted Herreshoff style with curved cabin sides joining to a point forward reminiscent of the classic S-Boats and Fish Class boats.
Cabin sides are of solid Teak. Cabin top carlins and beams are of laminated White Oak overlaid with marine plywood and covered with Dynel cloth set in epoxy. Cabin sides are varnished and exterior cabin top surface is Pearl Gray Awlgrip in both smooth and nonskid areas.
Aft cabin bulkhead is of tongue and groove White Cedar painted semi-gloss White.
Companionway entry is trimmed in varnished Teak with varnished Teak sliding hatch and vertical drop boards.


COCKPIT CONSTRUCTION

Varnished solid Teak cockpit coamings and seats. Cockpit floors are of solid White Oak with solid Teak board cockpit sole. Cockpit sole lift-out allows access to storage space under the cockpit sole. Bulkheads fore and aft of cockpit are tongue and groove White cedar painted semi-gloss White.
The cockpit differs from the standard BP24 arrangement in that the cockpit sole is considerably deeper than the factory built boats making for a very secure and comfortable feel when aboard. There are a manually and electric bilge pumps. When not sailing there has a custom canvas boom tent with built in solar charger that not only keeps rain water out of the cockpit but also covers and protects the on-deck varnished brightwork with only the varnished Teak toerails exposed to the elements.


INTERIOR FEATURES

Simple daysailor interior. Solid White Oak floors with solid Teak board cabin sole. Settees port and starboard are of varnished White cedar with lift-outs to allow access to storage space under settees. Centre teak engine box. Interior (FRP) hull sides are covered by White Cedar ceilings painted semi-gloss White. Fore and aft tongue and groove White Cedar bulkheads are finished in the same style. Overall the fir and finish of the interior spaces is such that one feels they are down below in a classic wooden daysailor of years gone by.


DECK HARDWARE

Bronze chocks and cleats
Lewmar low-profile ventilation / deck hatch forward
Varnished Teak lazzerrette hatch
Varnished Teak toerails and taffrail


PROPULSION

14HP Nanni inboard diesel to a shaft and prop. Aluminum fuel tank under cockpit. Cockpit controls.


ELECTRICAL

Single 12-volt battery supplies power to 12-volt outlet and mast lighting (Lopolight LED masthead tricolor) Solar and engine charging systems.


SAIL HANDLING EQUIPMENT

Lewmar #16, single-speed, self-tailing, bronze primary (sheet) winches mounted on Sparten Marine bronze winch bases outboard of cockpit coaming (port & starboard).
Lewmar #6, single-speed, bronze secondary (halyard) winches on cabin top (port & starboard)
Schaefer main sheet traveler
Schaefer genoa tracks and cars
Harken line organizers and cam cleats


STEERING

Keel hung rudder
Solid FRP rudder with bronze rudder shaft.
Laminated White Oak tiller with tiller extension.


ELECTRONICS & NAVIGATION

2015 Raymarine Chart plotter, compass and Raymarine multi depth & speed.


SPARS & RIGGING

Metalmast single-spreader, fractionally rigged aluminum mast and boom
Spars painted Pearl Gray Awlgrip
1x19 stainless steel wire standing rigging (shrouds and stays) with bronze turnbuckle adjusters
Adjustable backstay
Low stretch line halyards for main, headsail and spinnaker.
Main sheet, genoa sheets, spinnaker sheets, rope vang and all appropriate blocks.
Masthead Windex

 


SAILS & CANVAS

Sails by Doyle Sailmakers (2007): Mainsail, Working Jib, 135% Genoa, UPS Cruising Spinnaker
Sails by Maine Sailing Partners (2008): 150% Genoa
Custom canvas boom tent / cockpit and sail cover


ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT

2007 Double-axel Triad trailer with spare wheel and ladder
Fortress anchor with chain and rode
Docklines and fenders
